summary: Build an Internet Computer (ICP) application called “NG COIN” (using Caffeine) for a community-driven impact project: Internet Identity auth, strict admin/user roles, onboarding, private+public user profiles with admin validation, points system, community live chat/guestbook, events with RSVP and counters, partners page, and a private admin dashboard; data stored on ICP canisters with strict access controls.
architectural_notes: Frontend separated from backend; single backend canister for logic/data (initially).
Authentication via Internet Identity; enforce permissions in every backend method (admin vs user).
Persist application state in stable variables; validate inputs before writes.
Admin identified by a specific ICP Principal ID; admin-only routes/methods must be strictly protected.
Add a per-user account visibility setting (Public vs Private) and enforce it in backend queries that expose public profiles and in frontend navigation/directory visibility.

Navigation requirement: provide clickable menu entries for all available feature pages, with visibility controlled by auth/onboarding/admin gating so every permitted function is reachable from the UI.
known_issues: User reports admin dashboard, event creation, and live chat are not visible after login; likely admin principal not configured/recognized and/or feature visibility gated by onboarding/auth state.

Even when logging in with the intended admin identity, the user cannot see any navigation links to reach onboarding or access the gated menus; onboarding/menu entrypoint may be missing or hidden due to gating logic.

App gets stuck in an infinite loading state before rendering any UI (user cannot see/login to access menus); likely an auth/session initialization, routing, or canister call hang that blocks initial render.
After deployment (v7), app shows "Initialization Error: Failed to load your profile. You can still browse public pages" indicating profile-loading failure during auth/initialization.
Deployment/build to the network failed; requires retry and investigation of deployment error if it persists.

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity authentication and session handling so users can sign in/out and the UI consistently reflects authentication state.

Create a mandatory onboarding flow/page in English explaining the NG COIN project, global vision, and community values; require Internet Identity login to complete onboarding and unlock community access.

Implement private user profile data model (visible only to the user and admin) with the specified fields and CRUD capabilities for the user; enforce backend access control so only the owner and admin can read/write private profile data.
Award 500 points exactly once when a user completes the private profile (define and implement a clear ‘complete’ rule) and show the points total on the user profile page.

Implement public profile data model managed by the admin (public biography, company name, website link, social links, services offered) and expose public profiles only for users approved by the admin.

Implement admin “Validated” status per user profile with validate/unvalidate actions; award 1000 points exactly once when a profile is validated by the admin; display validated status badge in the community directory and profile views.
Implement community access rules: only logged-in users who completed onboarding can view the full community profiles directory and individual public profiles.
Implement a community points system on the backend using the specified rules and make points visible on user profile and an optional community leaderboard.

Build a community chat / live guestbook where logged-in users can post messages; award 50 points per posted message; provide a clean, simple ‘live’ interface that updates frequently (polling-based) and supports admin moderation (remove/hide messages).

Implement a voting mechanism available only to logged-in users (define voting target within the app, e.g., upvote/downvote on chat messages), award 50 points per vote under clear constraints, and show vote counts in the UI.

Implement events management: admin can create and manage events (title, description, date & time, location online/physical); users can RSVP “I will participate” or “I will not participate”; each event page shows a live participation counter (yes/no counts) updated frequently.

Create a Partners page with 4 partner cards, each containing a logo image, a short description (English), and an external website link, for: https://www.dmc-technologies.fr, https://www.ngenvironnement.org, https://iorga.com, http://metadev3.com.

Implement a private Admin Dashboard UI (accessible only to the admin principal) to: validate/unvalidate profiles, edit public profile content, create/manage events, moderate chat messages, and view community statistics (users, messages, events, points).

Apply a consistent, clean, modern, mobile-first visual theme across the app in English, with community-oriented layout, clear icons, intuitive navigation, and no complex Web3 terminology; choose a distinct style that does not rely on blue/purple as the primary palette.

Add generated static image assets (app logo + partner logos) into the frontend and render them in the UI (e.g., header/onboarding for app logo; Partners page for partner logos) without serving images through the backend.

Update the Community Directory participant cards to include clear “Learn more” links for each participant, including: (1) an internal link to the participant’s detailed public profile page, and (2) when available, a direct external link to the participant’s website.

On the participant public profile detail page, make all available participant links actionable so users can easily learn more: render the website as an external link button and render social links as clickable external links whenever they contain valid URL(s).
Ensure the Partners page uses consistent “Learn more” language by presenting the existing external website action as a “Learn more” link/button for each partner.
Add a dedicated "Sponsors" section to the public Landing page (frontend/src/pages/LandingPage.tsx) that lists the four sponsors and provides external website links for each sponsor.

Use consistent external-link UI language for sponsor website actions by labeling each sponsor website action as "Learn more" (English) and styling it consistently with existing external link buttons (e.g., the Partners page external link button pattern).
Add primary navigation links in the top header (AppShell) for onboarded, authenticated users, including direct links to the existing Events and Community Guestbook pages.

Ensure header navigation remains responsive: on small screens, keep the existing bottom navigation behavior; on larger screens, header links should be visible without removing the existing desktop navigation unless it is intentionally replaced by the header links.

Add a visible in-app menu in the main app navigation (AppShell header and mobile bottom navigation) that includes an entry for the live guestbook (chat) and an admin-only entry for event creation, using English labels.
Make the admin-only "Create Event" menu entry open the admin dashboard directly on the Events management UI, without requiring extra clicks.

Update the main AppShell navigation so that authenticated users who have not completed onboarding (including users with no profile yet) can always access the onboarding flow via a clearly visible menu link to "/onboarding" (English label), even when other community navigation items remain hidden due to onboarding gating.
Ensure the application never gets stuck on the full-screen "Loading..." spinner before showing any UI (header, Sign In/Sign Out button, and at least the public routes).

Make backend actor creation and the call to initialize admin access control non-blocking and fault-tolerant so it cannot indefinitely block app rendering (e.g., do not await a canister call that may hang as part of the actor query resolution).

Add a user-visible, English error/fallback state when authentication initialization, actor creation, or profile loading fails or takes unusually long, including a clear recovery action (Retry and/or Reload).

Investigate and fix the root cause of the app showing the initialization banner error state: "Initialization Error" + "Failed to load your profile. You can still browse public pages" after sign-in, ensuring the caller profile query becomes reliable in production (no unexpected query rejection/trap, no candid decoding errors, and no transient agent/canister errors causing a permanent error state).

Update frontend profile loading to clearly distinguish between (a) a legitimate "no profile yet" state (unregistered user / profile is null) and (b) a real profile-loading failure, so that pages do not show the generic error text when the user simply has no profile yet.

Improve the initialization error recovery behavior so that the global "Retry" action in the InitializationBanner reliably re-attempts the specific failing initialization step(s) (auth/actor/profile) and clears the banner when the system recovers.

Extend the private user profile (backend `UserProfile`) to include a user-editable `displayName` field, and add private fields for `website` and `socialLinks` so a user can store their web page link and social network links.

Clearly differentiate “Private profile” vs “Public profile” in the profile UX: on `frontend/src/pages/MyProfilePage.tsx`, present the user-editable private profile section as “Private profile” and add a separate “Public profile” section explaining it is visible to other members only when published/validated by an admin.

Ensure a user can view a “Public profile” summary for their own account even if it is not validated yet, to support the private/public distinction. Add a backend query to fetch the caller’s own public profile without requiring validation, and render it read-only in the “Public profile” section on the My Profile page when available.

Make “Display name” appear in public-facing profile views wherever a person/name is presented: use the public profile’s display name (if present) as the primary title/fallback in the Community Directory and the Public Profile detail page, instead of showing only company name or a generic label.
Update the public profile data model (backend `PublicProfile`) and the admin Public Profile Editor UI to support a `displayName` field, so admins can set what is shown publicly if needed.
Add a user-controlled account visibility setting so each authenticated user can choose whether their account is Public or Private, and persist this choice in the backend private profile state.
Provide a dedicated admin certification (validation) area in the admin UI so the administrator can certify/uncertify users clearly from a single, explicit admin section.
Update the live guestbook so it displays messages from all registered/onboarded users who post a message (not only a subset), while keeping admin moderation/removal capability.

Re-run the full project build and Internet Computer deployment, and if deployment fails again, identify the exact failing step (frontend build, Motoko compile, candid generation, asset bundling, or canister install/upgrade) and fix the underlying cause so the deployment completes successfully.

Add/adjust build-time safeguards so that common deployment blockers are caught with clear, actionable error output (for example: TypeScript compilation errors, Motoko compiler errors, and candid/interface mismatches), without changing the application’s runtime user-facing behavior.

Update the main app navigation in `frontend/src/components/layout/AppShell.tsx` so that every feature/page that is available to the current user state is reachable via an explicit, clearly clickable menu entry (not only via redirects or hidden routes). The menu must adapt by role/state:
- Public (not signed in): show clickable entries for at least "Home" and "Partners".
- Authenticated but not onboarded: show a prominent clickable entry "Complete Onboarding" (link to `/onboarding`) plus the public entries.
- Authenticated + onboarded: show clickable entries for all community pages: "Community" (`/community`), "Live Guestbook" (`/chat`), "Events" (`/events`), "Points" (`/leaderboard`), "My Profile" (`/profile`), plus public entries.
- Admin (in addition to the above): show a clickable "Admin Dashboard" entry (`/admin`) and a clickable "Create Event" entry that opens `/admin?tab=events`.
User-facing labels must be in English.

Ensure the clickable menu experience is responsive and accessible on small screens: all options described in REQ-49 must remain discoverable and tappable on mobile without relying on hover-only interactions, and the current active page should be visually indicated in the menu.

Add an admin-only navigation menu entry labeled "Profile Management" in `frontend/src/components/layout/AppShell.tsx` that is visible to admins (same visibility rules as existing admin items) and navigates directly to the Admin Dashboard profile management area by opening `/admin?tab=profiles`. The entry must appear in both the desktop navigation and the mobile sheet menu, and the active-route highlighting must work when the current URL is `/admin?tab=profiles`.

new_feature_requests.summary: ICP app foundation (Caffeine) with Internet Identity authentication and role-based access (single admin by Principal ID, users by ICP identity)
Mandatory onboarding flow/page explaining project vision and values; users must connect ICP identity to join
User profiles: private profile (user+admin only) with required fields; public profile managed/published by admin; admin can set "Validated" status; logged-in users can view full public profiles
Community points/score system with defined rules (registration, profile completion, chat posting, voting, admin validation) and display on profile plus optional leaderboard
Community chat / live guestbook (public feed for logged-in users) with real-time/simple UI, message posting, moderation, and points for posting
Events management: admin creates events (title, description, date/time, location); users RSVP yes/no; show live participation counters
Partners page with partner cards (logo, short description, external link) for DMC Technologies, NG Environnement, Iorga, and Metadev
Admin dashboard (private): validate/unvalidate profiles, edit public profiles, manage events, moderate chat, view community statistics (users/messages/events/points)
Data & security requirements: users access only own private data; public data visible only after admin approval; strict protection for admin-only routes; store data on ICP canisters
UI/UX requirements: English, clean/simple/modern, mobile-first, community-oriented, clear navigation/icons, avoid complex Web3 terminology
Implement backend role model with a single Admin identified by a configurable ICP Principal ID and enforce strict authorization checks for all admin-only operations.
Implement user registration on first login and award 100 points for registration exactly once per principal.

Store all application data on the ICP canister and enforce security rules in backend methods so: users can only access their own private data; public data is visible only after admin approval; admin-only operations are strictly protected.
Add “learn more” links for all project participants (e.g., from participant cards in the community directory to their detailed public profile and/or external website/social links where available).
Add/ensure sponsor section includes external website links for NG Environnement, DMC Technologies, Iorga, and Metadev (ngenvironnement.org, dmc-technologies.fr, iorga.com, metadev3.com).
Add navigation links in the app header (e.g., to Events and Live Guestbook pages)

Add a visible in-app menu that includes entries for "Création évènement" (event creation) and "Livre d’or" as a live chat/guestbook, with access/visibility consistent with auth/onboarding/admin rules.

Add a visible navigation/menu link to access the Onboarding flow from the main menu (especially for logged-in users who have not completed onboarding), so users/admin can reach onboarding and then unlock other menus.

Update profile UX/data model to clearly differentiate Private vs Public profile sections, add a user-facing Display Name field, and ensure social network links + website link fields are available and shown appropriately.

Update the private-profile completion rule so it remains well-defined after adding the new fields: keep the existing required fields for completion (do not make website/social links required unless explicitly specified).

Add upgrade safety for existing deployed data when changing profile record types: implement conditional migration so existing stored profiles continue to load with sensible defaults for newly added fields.
Add an explicit user choice of account visibility: user selects whether their account/public presence is Public or Private (opt-in public account), with UI + backend rules reflecting this choice.

Enforce account visibility rules across community-visible public profile access: users who choose a Private account must not appear in community public listings and must not have a community-viewable public profile page, while still allowing the owner and admin to view/manage their data where appropriate.
Add upgrade safety for the new account visibility field so existing deployed user profiles continue to decode/load correctly after upgrade (conditional migration as needed).

Create clearly clickable navigation/menu entries for every available app option (feature) appropriate to the user’s role/state (public, authenticated, onboarded, admin) so all functions are reachable via the UI.
Add an admin-only navigation/menu entry for “Profile management” that takes the admin directly to the profile management area (validate/unvalidate users, edit public profiles) in the Admin Dashboard.
